permafrost.tundra.net.http.route

Class HTTPRouter

  • java.lang.Object
    • permafrost.tundra.net.http.route.HTTPRouter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.wm.app.b2b.server.HTTPHandler

    public class HTTPRouter
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.wm.app.b2b.server.HTTPHandler
    webMethods Integration Server HTTP handler which allows arbitrary HTTP request routing.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_INVOKE_DIRECTIVE
      The default directive used for invoking services.
      static java.lang.String INVOKE_REQUEST_URL
      A request URL which matches the invoke directive, used to fool the AuditLogManager so it does not log spurious Access Denied errors.
      static java.lang.String WATT_SERVER_INVOKE_DIRECTIVE
      The Integration Server configuration key for a custom invoke directive.

      • Fields inherited from interface com.wm.app.b2b.server.HTTPHandler

        WATT_SERVER_NOACCESSURL, WATT_SERVER_NOOBJECTURL

      • process

        public final boolean process(com.wm.app.b2b.server.ProtocolState state)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             com.wm.app.b2b.server.AccessException
        Processes an HTTP request.
        Specified by:
        process in interface com.wm.app.b2b.server.HTTPHandler
        Parameters:
        state - The HTTP request to be processed.
        Returns:
        True if this object was able to process the HTTP request, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O problem is encountered reading from or writing to the client socket.
        com.wm.app.b2b.server.AccessException - If the the HTTP request requires authentication or is not authorized.

        Reloads the HTTP routing table from the package HTTP route configuration files.

      • refreshDirectives

        protected void refreshDirectives(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> oldDirectives,
                                 java.util.Set<java.lang.String> newDirectives)
        Register this object with the Integration Server HTTP request dispatcher for all the directives in the routing table.
        Parameters:
        oldDirectives - The previously registered directives which must now be unregistered.
        newDirectives - The new directives to be registered.
